text:
I am using this query shown below in the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/analytics/get-analytics-data-breakdowns?_ga=2.152485049.1258740892.1655976071-1386400630.1649736097|official page> to get the data related to all the campaigns, but it uses a *total* as a parameter, I want to use *daily time period instead of total*.

Get a summary of all visits across all campaigns (anything included in the utm_campaign parameter): <https://api.hubapi.com/analytics/v2/reports/utm-campaigns/total?hapikey=demo&start=20180101&end=20180301>

When I want to use the daily time period instead of the total one, it requires me to use an additional filter, but *I do not want to filter the data further*.

I tried to find a workaround to skip the filtering part, but in the documentation, it is not clear how to use the filter option and what are all the available options, so I tried to use a dummy filter like &f=true to call the API, but it returns an empty result.

*Can you please help me to find a way to not filter the data further, I just need to know what kind of filtering options are available and why I can not apply some kind of default filter like &f=true to get all the campaign data in a daily format without applying any actual filter?*

Hello :wave: I'm using <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php> to interact with HubSpot api, when dealing with engagement, it works great for notes (listing/retrivieng/creating/deleting, but when I use the same logic with calls it doesn't seem to work, for instance this call :
```$calls = $this
            ->getClient()
            ->crm()
            ->objects()
            ->сalls()
            ->basicApi()
            ->getPage(null, null, null, null);```
results in this exception : `Exception with message 'Unable to discover "сalls" client'`  any idea ?

Getting an error when creating a bool property like so:
```"name": "prop_name",
"description": "prop desc",
"type": "bool",
"fieldType": "booleancheckbox",
"options": [
  {
     "label": "Yes",
     "description": "Yes",
     "value": "true",
     "displayOrder": 1,
     "hidden": false
  },
  {
     "label": "No",
     "description": "no",
     "value": "false",
     "displayOrder": 2,
     "hidden": false
  }
],
"groupName":"companyinformation"```
The error says *`Boolean properties must have exactly two options; one with a value of 'true', the other with a value of 'false'`*
*Which is already in there* :face_with_raised_eyebrow:
I tried sending the true/false as bool or strings (which as expected doesn't matter)
Any thoughts?
should true and false be in quotes?
That was my initial test, but same issue
Also value should be without quotes

Hello Team
Anyone know about SMS Channel ?

that didn't worked.
Either switching to boolean instead bool

_*date]*_

Hello
I need message and calling between HubSpot contact and my own app reliable pbx.
So i ask you regarding SMS channel.
or how to add custom call button in contact page, onclick call button called my own API with contact and owner contact.
if anyone possible then give me proper solution.

funny enough, I just needed to implement this. I haven’t tested it well with multiple pages yet (hard to find that case in the current instance i’m working in), but here’s what I came up with:
```import requests

def fetch_pages(url, api_key, results=[]):
    r = requests.get(url=url, params={"hapikey": api_key})
    try:
        r.raise_for_status()
        response = r.json()
        results.extend(response["results"])
        if "paging" in response.keys():
            url = response["paging"]["next"]["link"]
            fetch_pages(url, api_key, results=results)
    except Exception as err:
        print(r.text)
        raise err
    return results```
